channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Alec Baldwin’s Trial Pauses as Unexamined Rounds Are Brought Into Court
item.description: The actor’s lawyers have asked the judge to dismiss the case over the state’s failure to disclose evidence that could help shed light on how live rounds reached the “Rust” film set.

item.title: High School Collapses in Nigeria, Killing Several Students
item.description: An unknown number of people were trapped in the rubble of the building in Jos, a city of one million residents in the central part of the country.

item.title: Inflation becomes a wholesalers’ problem as producer prices surge
item.description: The Producer Price Index posted the largest one-month increase in over a year.

item.title: Trump’s Subtle Shift in His V.P. Calculations
item.description: Donald J. Trump appears to be giving more weight to political calculations in selecting a running mate, by picking someone who “helps you get elected.”

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Gaza City Neighborhood Left in Ruins After Israeli Withdrawal
item.description: Residents and rescue workers say they found dozens of bodies and most of the buildings destroyed in the Shajaiye neighborhood after Israeli forces ended a two-week offensive against Hamas fighters.

item.title: Tech’s war for AI talent is creating a ‘massive consolidation’ problem, lawmakers say
item.description: So-called “acqui-hires,” in which one company acquires another to absorb talent, allow companies to avoid regulatory scrutiny.

item.title: The End of the Affair? Not for Eric Schmidt.
item.description: While Mr. Schmidt was chief executive of Google, he had an extramarital relationship with Marcy Simon, a public relations executive. A decade after they split, things are still messy.

item.title: Nepal’s Prime Minister Dahal Loses Confidence Vote in Parliament
item.description: The latest political upheaval comes as Nepal struggles to cope with deadly disasters like a landslide on Friday that left more than 60 people missing.

item.title: Jamie Dimon: Prices will be higher for longer
item.description: The JPMorgan Chase CEO also warned that geopolitical instability could present future risks.

item.title: As Biden Stays Put, Democrats Fear Blues States May Become Battlegrounds
item.description: Lingering worries about President Biden’s age could make Minnesota, New Hampshire, New Mexico and Virginia competitive, party operatives believe.

item.title: Pakistan Court Grants Imran Khan’s Party More Seats in Parliament
item.description: A ruling by Pakistan’s high court strips the governing coalition of its two-thirds majority, and thrusts the party of Imran Khan back onto the political main stage.

item.title: Tesla’s AI dreams may ‘materialize on a longer time horizon (or not at all),’ UBS warns
item.description: “While TSLA is investing heavily in AI and the tech is making progress, investment is costly, pace of improvement may slow and the payoff is long dated,” UBS analyst Joseph Spak warned.

item.title: SpaceX Rocket Fails, Breaking Apart in Orbit
item.description: The failure, the first since 2016, ended a streak of more than 300 successful launches for the Falcon 9 rocket.

item.title: Finland Passes Law to Turn Away Asylum Seekers at Border
item.description: The country last year closed all land crossings with Russia, accusing Moscow of trying to weaponize migration. Russian authorities have called the accusations “unsubstantiated.”

item.title: Apple stock poised to rise 11% on iPhone AI updates, says BoA
item.description: The bank’s global smartphone survey reveals a commitment among iPhone users to upgrade, eyeing soon-to-launch generative AI features.
